Description: Established on October 24, 2018, the VNRVJIET ACM Student Chapter at VNR Vignana Jyothi Institute of Engineering and Technology, Hyderabad, unites tech enthusiasts, educators, and professionals to share knowledge and explore innovations in computing. As part of ACM’s global community, the chapter promotes awareness of emerging technologies and fosters teamwork, learning, and professional growth. With over 800 members and 45+ successful events, it continues to inspire students through workshops, hackathons, seminars, coding contests, panel discussions, webinars, and networking activities.

The ASME Student Chapter at VNR VJIET, established in April 2012, connects mechanical engineering students to a global network focused on innovation and real-world problem-solving. With active participation from 83 students and two faculty members, the chapter organizes key events like the Human Powered Vehicle Challenge, Aero Design Challenge, and Electric Solar Vehicle Championship, alongside guest lectures and technical activities—fostering collaboration, skill development, and excellence in engineering.

The Computer Society of India (CSI) Student Chapter at VNRVJIET is a professional platform for students to enhance technical skills, industry exposure, and leadership abilities. It bridges the gap between academic learning and real-world computing practices through workshops, seminars, coding contests, hackathons, and project showcases. The chapter encourages students to explore emerging technologies like AI, cloud computing, web/mobile development, and collaborate on innovative projects. Students gain hands-on experience, teamwork, problem-solving skills, and networking opportunities with professionals and alumni. CSI also promotes participation in national and international competitions, helping students build a strong portfolio for placements and higher studies. Overall, it is a hub for learning, innovation, and professional growth in computing and IT.

Proffesional student chapters: GDSC( Google Developer Student Club) or GDGC(Google developers group on campus)
Description: The Google Developer Student Club (GDSC) at VNR VJIET is a dynamic student community united by a shared drive for technology and innovation. GDSC empowers students to become leaders and problem-solvers, offering hands-on workshops, events, talks, and project-building activities across diverse technical topics. Open to all disciplines and experience levels, GDSC fosters collaboration, learning, and real-world growth—supporting students online and in-person to connect, learn, and give back to their communities while expanding their professional networks and skills

The Indian Concrete Institute (ICI) Student Chapter at VNRVJIET is a professional platform for students interested in civil engineering, concrete technology, and sustainable construction practices. It aims to bridge classroom learning and real-world applications by organizing workshops, seminars, project exhibitions, and site visits. The chapter encourages students to explore innovations in structural design, construction materials, and green building practices, while developing teamwork, problem-solving, and leadership skills. Students also gain opportunities to participate in competitions, industry interactions, and research projects, enhancing their technical knowledge and professional readiness. Overall, the ICI chapter fosters innovation, practical experience, and holistic growth for aspiring civil engineers.

The IEEE Student Chapter at VNRVJIET is a global platform for students interested in electronics, electrical, and computer engineering. It provides opportunities to enhance technical knowledge, leadership, and professional skills through workshops, seminars, hackathons, and project competitions. The chapter encourages students to explore emerging technologies like IoT, AI, robotics, and automation, while promoting teamwork, problem-solving, and networking with professionals and alumni. IEEE also enables participation in national and international events, helping students gain practical experience and industry exposure. Overall, it fosters innovation, professional growth, and technical excellence.

The IGBC Student Chapter at VNRVJIET focuses on sustainability, green building, and environmental engineering. It aims to bridge academic learning and practical applications by organizing workshops, seminars, green projects, and site visits. Students are encouraged to explore innovations in sustainable design, energy efficiency, and eco-friendly construction practices. The chapter develops teamwork, leadership, and problem-solving skills, while providing opportunities for industry interaction and project-based learning. Overall, it nurtures environmental awareness, innovation, and practical experience for students interested in sustainable engineering.

The IEI Student Chapter at VNRVJIET is a multidisciplinary platform for students across engineering branches to enhance technical knowledge, leadership, and practical skills. It organizes workshops, seminars, guest lectures, and project exhibitions to expose students to real-world engineering challenges. The chapter encourages participation in national-level competitions, interdisciplinary projects, and industry interactions. Students develop teamwork, problem-solving, and professional competencies while gaining exposure to emerging technologies and engineering practices. Overall, the IEI chapter promotes holistic growth, innovation, and professional readiness among engineering students.

The ISOI Student Chapter at VNRVJIET focuses on instrumentation, measurement systems, and control engineering. It provides students with opportunities to enhance technical knowledge and practical skills through workshops, seminars, and hands-on projects. The chapter encourages exploration of automation, sensors, instrumentation devices, and emerging technologies. Students also gain teamwork, problem-solving, and leadership experience, along with exposure to industry professionals. Overall, ISOI fosters innovation, practical learning, and professional growth for aspiring engineers in instrumentation and control systems.

The ISTE Student Chapter at VNRVJIET aims to promote technical education, skill development, and leadership among students. It organizes workshops, seminars, and professional development activities across disciplines. The chapter encourages innovation, research, and collaborative projects, while offering opportunities for networking and mentorship. Students develop problem-solving, teamwork, and professional skills through participation in technical events. Overall, ISTE provides a platform for holistic growth, knowledge enhancement, and career readiness in engineering and technology.

Proffesional student chapters: IETE (Institution of Electronics and Telecommunication Engineers)
Description: The IETE Student Chapter at VNRVJIET is focused on electronics, telecommunication, and IT systems. It aims to bridge academic learning and industry exposure through workshops, seminars, hands-on projects, and competitions. Students explore embedded systems, IoT, signal processing, and emerging electronic technologies, while developing technical, problem-solving, and teamwork skills. The chapter also provides opportunities for industry interaction, mentorship, and professional networking. Overall, IETE fosters innovation, technical expertise, and professional development in electronics and telecommunication fields.

The IUCEE Student Chapter at VNRVJIET focuses on engineering education, innovation, and interdisciplinary collaboration. It provides students with opportunities to participate in competitions, workshops, and collaborative projects with a global perspective. The chapter encourages research, critical thinking, and leadership development, while offering networking opportunities with educators and professionals worldwide. Students gain practical experience, problem-solving skills, and exposure to international best practices in engineering education. Overall, IUCEE nurtures innovation, global awareness, and professional growth among students.

The SAE Student Chapter at VNRVJIET is dedicated to automotive and mobility engineering. It provides students with opportunities to design, fabricate, and test vehicles or automotive systems through competitions and projects. The chapter organizes workshops, seminars, and industry visits to enhance technical knowledge and practical skills. Students develop teamwork, project management, problem-solving, and leadership abilities while exploring innovations in automotive design, electric vehicles, and sustainable mobility solutions. Overall, SAE fosters hands-on experience, technical excellence, and professional growth for aspiring automotive engineers.

The Turing Hut at VNRVJIET is the programming and coding club of the institute. It provides students with a platform to enhance problem-solving, algorithmic thinking, and software development skills. The club organizes coding competitions, hackathons, workshops, and peer-learning sessions. Students get opportunities to explore data structures, algorithms, web/mobile development, and competitive programming. Turing Hut also encourages teamwork, mentorship, and participation in national/international contests. Overall, it nurtures programming expertise, technical innovation, and professional readiness for students passionate about coding.

The VSI Student Chapter at VNRVJIET focuses on automotive, vehicle systems, and innovation in mobility solutions. It offers students opportunities to design, develop, and test mechanical and electrical systems in vehicles. The chapter organizes workshops, competitions, project showcases, and industry visits. Students gain experience in engineering design, problem-solving, teamwork, and project management. VSI encourages exploration of electric vehicles, autonomous systems, and sustainable mobility innovations. Overall, it fosters hands-on learning, technical skills, and innovative thinking for aspiring automotive and mobility engineers.

The Student Council at VNRVJIET is a leadership and representation body that connects students with campus administration and organizes co-curricular, cultural, and technical activities. It provides students with opportunities to develop leadership, organizational, and communication skills. The council oversees events, competitions, student welfare initiatives, and community engagement programs. It encourages teamwork, responsibility, and initiative-taking among students. Overall, the Student Council nurtures leadership, holistic development, and active participation in campus life.
